head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #17

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #17 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on Board the Nancy laying at anchor in the roads off Michilimakinac in the month of September, 13

not sail until tomorrow morning, I then let 3 on board, & commenced taking in sugar and other goods for different persons – wind this day at SW, & very foggy weather at times, at 8 PM set the watch – (between 8 & 10 & 12 of last night the watch is found asleep by me I take the time glass out of the Binnacle, about a quarter of an hour afterwards he discovers the glass to be gone, after which he walks the deck for the Rest of the night.)
All this days blows a gale from the ENE, greased down the masts – cloudy & cool weather[.]
Fore part of this day blows a gale at East with frequent showers of rain, latter part of the day continues blowing fresh with a heavy sea – at 8 PM Set the watch[.]

Fore & latter part of this day blows a strong gale from the Eastward, with some rain, at 5 PM veered out the long service of the best bower & let the small bower go with about 10 fathom of cable pointed the yards – a very dark awfull sky – at ½ past 6 PM light shower of rain, (we are at present about ¾ of a cable length from the beach in ¼ less 3[.])

Fore part of this day the gale still continues from the Eastward with a heavy sea running, at 2 P[M] moderates hove up the small bower & shortend of the best bower, at 5 the sea abates considerably coiled away such of the cables as were dry, at 8 set the watch, wind freshens again from the same quarter – morning of this day light shower of rain & fog until noon[.] Afternoon fog goes of – at 8 Weather looks more settled – set the watch[.]
no communication with the shore this day

Fore part of this day blows fresh at East loosed the jibbs, & fore sail, to dry, at noon the square sail, at 1 PM wind encreases to a gale, handed sails, at 8 set the watch at ½ past 8 wind encreases, let go the small bower cloudy weather all this day.
no communication with the Shore this day[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
